title: NASA just lost yet another one of its low-cost planetary missions
summary: It's increasingly unlikely that Lunar Trailblazer will deliver quality science.

title: SatixFy gets UK funds to accelerate in-orbit satellite reconfiguration
summary:
The UK Space Agency has awarded SatixFy funds to develop software to speed up how quickly reprogrammable satellites can adapt to changing needs in orbit, the Israeli chipmaker announced March 5.
The post SatixFy gets UK funds to accelerate in-orbit satellite reconfiguration appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Nord Stream methane leak far bigger than estimated
summary: The methane emitted in 2022 by the damaged Nord Stream gas pipelines was more than double the volume estimated at the time, according to a study published in Nature.

summary:

title: SpaceX announces Starship Flight 8’s new target date
summary:
Starship's eighth flight test is scheduled for Thursday, March 6, with the launch window opening at 5:30 p.m. CT.
The post SpaceX announces Starship Flight 8’s new target date appeared first on TESLARATI.

title: ISS astronauts reject call for early retirement of the station
summary:
Astronauts on the International Space Station said they disagreed with Elon Musk’s claim that the station was past its prime and should be deorbited soon.
The post ISS astronauts reject call for early retirement of the station appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Striking images tell the story of space weather
summary: A compelling collection of images that illustrates humanity’s efforts to mitigate the far-reaching impacts of violent solar outbursts has been unveiled in London.

title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 to Explore Deep Space Exercise, Health
summary: During NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 mission to the International Space Station, which is scheduled to launch in March, select members of the four-person crew will participate in exercise and medical research aimed at keeping astronauts fit on future long-duration missions. Crew members living and working aboard the space station have access to a designated training area […]

title: Public Consultation Begins for New Microlauncher Launch Site in French Guiana
summary:
The French space agency CNES has opened a public consultation period for the new multi-user microlauncher facility at the Guiana Space Centre in French Guiana. The consultation will focus on the site’s environmental authorization and building permit request. On 17 February, the first of four public consultation sessions into the construction of the new Multi-Launcher […]
The post Public Consultation Begins for New Microlauncher Launch Site in French Guiana appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Apex’s first satellite marks one year in orbit
summary:
The first spacecraft built by satellite manufacturing startup Apex continues to work well after a year in orbit as the company leverages that experience for future spacecraft.
The post Apex’s first satellite marks one year in orbit appeared first on SpaceNews.
